channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.description:
Report X-2023080229

item.title: Report X-2023080193
item.description:
Report X-2023080193

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: ZELIENOPLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHEN THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS LOADING IT IN THE TRAILER IT WAS STRUCK ON THE CORNER OF THE ROLLERS CAUSING A PUNCTURE AND IT LEAK OUT. THE LOADSIDE MANAGER CALLED QA, WE CAME WITH A TOTE AND SPILL PADS. AND IT WAS PLACED IN THE HAZMAT CAGE DescribePack: DURING LOADING THE CONTAINER STRUCK THE CORNER OF THE METAL ROLLERS. THIS CAUSED A GASH IN THE CONTAINER CAUSING IT TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: THE CANISTER WAS PUT IN A TOTE AND PLACED ON ITS SIDE.

item.title: Report X-2023080093
item.description:
Report X-2023080093

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was proccessed and moving onto be loaded into trailer. At some point, mishandling may have led to box being dropped. Package did appear to be packed well and bottles were surrounded by molded foam, one glass bottle cracked, and this caused leakage. Package was immediately removed from conveyor belt system and placed in plastic lined security tub. Loose absorbent fill was used to collect liquid. DescribePack: Glass bottle cracked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Plastic lined tub used; loose absorbent filled used to collect spilled liquid.

DescribePack: INNER DRUM HAD MULTIPLE DENTS CAUSING THE LID TO OPEN DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN HAZ BAG AND PUT INTO CAGE

  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE. ARRIVED AT SPILL WITH PROPER PPE ON AND DECISION TREE IN HAND. AFTER CLEANING UP SPILL, RESPONDER TOOK HAZMAT TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023070495
item.description:
Report X-2023070495

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO UNLOAD FINDING FLAMMABLE LIQUID 3 LABEL ON PACKAGE. WEARING FULL PPE, RESPONDER READ DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET FOR A FLAMMABLE LIQUID 3. FOLLOWED ALL RESPONSE ACTION STEPS FINISHING WITH TRANSPORTING PACKAGE TO DMP AREA. RESPONDER PROCESSED PACKAGE THROUGH THE DMP. REFERED TO DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST AFTER DISPOSAL PROCESS WAS COMPLETED.

item.description:

  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO DOOR 633 WITH FULL PPE AND LOCATED A CORROSIVE LABEL 8 PACKAGE WET ON CORNER. RESPONDER READ DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET AND ADDED SILVER SHIELD GLOVES. NO SPILL TO AREA, SO TRANSPORTED PACKAGE TO DMP AREA. READ WASTE DISPOSAL CHART PRIOR TO PROCESSING THROUGH THE DMP. REFERRED TO DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST AFTER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023071217
item.description:
Report X-2023071217

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet. Came off trailer #838446 already wet leaking and damaged. Package handler Gage Ettinger was lifting the box unaware that the package was wet and leaking, got on his shin of leg. Manager was notified took steps for first aid. Package handler is fine. Upon inspecting the inner contents there were 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of Artic Ice Machine Cleaner. The 1 x 1 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .70 gallons to release. A corrugated liner was used in box to separate the bottles in box. No other absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed, contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The 1 x 1 gallon plastic bottle of Artic Ice Machine Cleaner had a loose cap allowing .70 gallons to release. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote to contain the leaking package and was taken to the hazmat cage for further inspection of box.

item.title: Report X-2023071199
item.description:
Report X-2023071199

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment was taken out of system flow due to external carton wet. Came off trailer # 821554 already wet leaking and damaged. There was 2 x 2.5-gallon plastic bottles of Resolution Liquid Machine Detergent. The 1 x 2.5 gallon bottle had a loose cap allowing .10 gallons to release. No absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The 1 x 2.5-gallon plastic bottle of Resolution Liquid Machine Detergent had a loose cap allowing .10 gallons to release. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote to contain the damaged leaking package, then taken to hazmat cage for further inspection of package.

item.title: Report X-2023071196
item.description:
Report X-2023071196

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet. Came off trailer #950500 already wet leaking and damaged. upon inspecting the inner contents there was 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of Nu Brite Condenser Coil Cleaner. The 1 x 1 plastic bottle of Nu Brite Condenser Coil Cleaner had a crushed in cap allowing .20 gallons to release from cap. Corrugated liner was used on the top of bottles and to separate the bottles inside the box. No other absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The 1 x 1 gallon plastic bottle of Nu Brite condenser coil cleaner had a crushed in cap allowing .20 gallon to release from cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote to contain the leaking package, taken to the hazmat cage for further inspection on package.

item.title: Report X-2023071183
item.description:
Report X-2023071183

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the package in a red hazardous material bin. I did not see any visible damage to the box. There was a strong odor coming from the box. I grabbed my PPE to inspect the box. There weren't any wet spots inside of the box. The bottles were packed in individual zip lock bags with absorbents inside separated by corrugated liners inside a big plastic bag. DescribePack: Three bottles' cap were barely on the bottle. Noticed there is a size difference of the bottle opening and the cap. The only thing that were keeping the caps on the bottles were black tape. The gasoline from each bottle spilled into the zip lock bag of absorbent. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Kept the bottle upright and placed into a drum to control the odor.

item.title: Report X-2023070294
item.description:
Report X-2023070294

item.title: Report X-2023071156
item.description:
Report X-2023071156

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-16
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came off trailer 568921 from the unload already wet leaking and damaged. Package was placed in a lined red tote and taken to the hazmat cage for inspection. Upon inspecting the inner contents there were 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of Foam Brite Condenser Coil Cleaner. The 1 x 1 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .20 gallons to release. Corrugated liner was on the top of the bottles and a liner was separating the bottles inside box. No other absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed, contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The 1 x 1 gallon plastic bottle of Foam Brite Condenser Coil Cleaner had a loose cap allowing .20 gallons to release. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote to contain the damaged leaking package, taken to the hazmat cage for further inspection.

item.title: Report X-2023071125
item.description:
Report X-2023071125

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-16
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The drum fell off the rollers in unload and spilled. The area was cleared while cleanup was in progress. After absorbing as much as possible with pads, a fan was placed blowing on it toward the bay door until the remainder dried. DescribePack: The drum landed on its lid after falling. This bent the lid and allowed it to spill. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The area was cleared while cleanup was in progress. After absorbing as much as possible with pads, a fan was placed blowing on it toward the bay door until the remainder dried.

item.title: Report X-2023071118

  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon opening the trailer it was discovered that packages had fallen into the hazmat, breaking one of the bottles. The package was placed in a lined hazmat bin and taken to QA to be processed as a damage. DescribePack: The top of one of the glass bottles had broken off and the hazmat had fallen over. spilling out virtually all of its contents. By the time the hazmat reached our facility, the contents had evaporated. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was removed and the trailer was aired out until it was safe to enter.

item.title: Report E-2023070809
item.description:
Report E-2023070809

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 11, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of potassium hydroxide released approximately two (2) ounces of product to the dock floor due to a loose cap. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted surfaces. ES personnel tightened the cap on the 55-gallon drum of potassium hydroxide. Crews utilized absorbents and a neutralizing agent to clean the top of the 55-gallon drum of potassium hydroxide. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report X-2023080126
item.description:
Report X-2023080126

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-19
  • City: ZELIENOPLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damaged package picked up from the unload with no limited quantity markings on the package. Upon inspection, the package was processed as an undeclared hazmat due to the lack of proper markings on the package. A SDS was obtained for damaged undeclared hazmat. Proper hazmat paperwork was filed. The leaking hazmat was placed in a hazmat bag as well as a red hazmat bin. The undeclared hazmat was the n brought to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: The three bottles of the Hypochlorite Solution were crushed with loose caps and leakage. This resulted in the leakage of 222 FL OZ from the bottles. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The leaking hazmat was placed in a hazmat bag as well as a red hazmat bin. The undeclared hazmat was the n brought to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report E-2023070870
item.description:
Report E-2023070870

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: BANGOR
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver arrived at customer location for a waste pickup. Upon opening the trailer door the driver discovered that the trailer floor was wet and smelled strong odor. Driver immediately called dispatch and placed spill pads and speedy dry to contain the liquid to the trailer. Management called for emergency response to respond. Response time was 2-3 hours. Driver stayed with the vehicle until the response crew arrived and material was transferred into another 5 gallon drum. Original drum was placed in an overpack along with any cleanup materials that were used. Cause of the failure was determined to be missing gasket and ring for drum was put on upside down. In addition to the missing gasket there was a pinhole discovered in the side of the drum where the drum had been picked for loading.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR A SPILL. ARRIVED WITH PROPER PPE ON AND DECISION TREE IN HAND. AFTER EXAMINING THE PACKAGE, RESPONDER FOUND THAT WAS A DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL. RESPONDER DECLARED THE SPILL TO BE HAZARDS AND FOLLOWED PROPER CLEAN UP OF PACKAGE. WHEN CLEAN UP WAS FINISHED, RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE TO THE D.M.P FOR FURTHER PROSSESING.

  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Norfolk Southern
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Norfolk Southern yard crew during normal switching operations observed TILX 270090 leaking. NS contractor was dispatched and found manway swing bolts were improperly secured. This resulted in a release of 1 gallon of product from the manway. Contractor opened the manway, inspected the gasket and found no defects. Manway swing bolts resecured.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: This package was found upside down inside of a truck the package was leaking. QA placed this package in a bin. DescribePack: The failure for this package was a loose cap of this 13lbs package about half of the liquid came out DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a bin and the top was tightened.
